page.title: 17The Bath Arms, Horningsham
page.content: The Bath Arms is situated at the western end of the village as is a very popular public house attracting visitors from a large surrounding area. There are two bars, a space to sit outside in front of the building and a large garden at the rear. It also has several bedrooms and welcomes guests from all over the world; many staying there when visiting Longleat House or taking part in pheasant or deer shoots. The Bath Arms has an excellent reputation for food and has a large kitchen employing several people. The present tenants have been in residence for five years. On the green in front of the puplic house are twelve trees known locally as the apostles.
